text: somebody please: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3235/>
I have merged it. We should really have more tests there...
<@U0Y14MWA2> added a test for every bug except this one :slightly_smiling_face:
but yeah, as there are bugs remaining we need more tests
I tried to squeeze that in - thanks <@U11MANG9G>
otherwise, I am adding tests whenever time allows
this one was merely about following the pbft writeup - but still I agree we could have tests
<@U1AU8DRQR>, <@U0Y14MWA2> [Gabor, Marko] NP. Let me know if I can help. I like it when we have a test that checks for the wrong results which passes only with the fix/patch.
Speaking of which, I am actually trying to list out a few tasks that we can also split and share with others… I think that some of this work can be carried out by others as well. Let’s see.

BTW: Don’t get me wrong: It will not be the first or the last time where a bug creeps in (even with a lot of tests). It’s all part of the game/cycles… we can’t cover everything, but we can try to reduce/mitigate some risk… So it’s all good/expected.
in case of pbft/sbft we need to cover nearly everything as it seems to be an infinite source of bugs to me :smile:
Yes, it is not really that “simple” a state-machine/chart. So many edge cases…  we really need MOAR tests.
